TripEvent.Name: Private transfer Keflavik Airport via Blue Lagoon to Hotel
TripEvent.Description: DL0246 arrives 09:30 Blue Lagoon booked for 11-143 hours wait at blue lagoon with luggage​Your driver will meet you holding a name sign. Luggage: 1 suitcase and 1 carry on per personA 3 hour stop at Blue Lagoon is included. Luggage can be left in the car while visiting the Lagoon.​If you are experiencing any issues with the transfer, please call Iceland Highlights on +354 415 0263Waiting time at the Airport is 45 minutes

TripEvent.Name: Blue Lagoon - comfort
TripEvent.Description: ISK (Dynamic rates)Blue Lagoon is approximately 45 minutes’ drive from Reykjavik City centre and 20 minutes’ drive from Keflavík International Airport. There are frequent scheduled bus transfers to Blue Lagoon from Reykjavik and the airport, throughout the year.If you have your own car, you will need to find your way to road nr. 41, leading southwest from Reykjavik towards the Reykjanes peninsula. Turn left on road nr. 43 and drive for about 10 minutes, then make a right turn to the Blue Lagoon area.Experience the wonders of the Blue Lagoon enhanced with the prime elements of hospitality and wellbeing. Includes:Entrance to the Blue LagoonSilica mud maskUse of towel1st drink of your choiceUse of shampoo, conditioner and moisturizerPlease find your voucher with the travel documents.​

Description.nts:gea: Exeter Hotel is a contemporary design hotel by the old Reykjavík harbour that offers local experience with all the perks of a hotel stay. The hotel’s main building is a restoration of a house originally built in 1904 as a storage and later used as a house of residence and trade. Now renovated and linked to new and modern buildings the hotel‘s exterior is a tribute both to contemporary architecture and times when fishing and trade where the area’s main industry.Embark on an adventure of luxury at the Exeter Hotel's Deluxe Rooms, where en suite bathrooms, modern amenities, and chic embellishments await. Perfect for unwinding, plotting your Icelandic escapades, or working on your next daring endeavour. Whether you crave a double or twin arrangement, these rooms offer easy access to upper floors via elevator, alongside thrilling extras like a flat-screen TV, Bluetooth speaker, and prompt wake-up service. Elevate your Exeter Hotel stay and embrace the adventure!

TripEvent.Name: Private Guided Food Walk with sightseeing
TripEvent.Description: DL0246 arrives 09:30 Blue Lagoon booked for 11-14, transfer to hotel after(Priority) 3 hours, Book Gourmet tastings for dinnerEnjoy a private food tasting tour through Reykjavik together with a passionate local guide. This walking tour covers Reykjavik's highlights. Along the way, you visit small, local restaurants and taste Icelandic delicacies ranging from traditional food to modern kitchen in street style to fine dining - a tasting journey you will remember! Please inform your guide of any dietary restrictions. Departure from: Your hotel in ReykjavikDuration: 3 hoursIncluded: Fully guided walking tour of Reykjavik including food tastings Activity level: Easy Tour Style: PrivateYour guide is Marteinn Briem. Please meet him at your hotel lobby.Kindly let him know if you are running late or wish to have the meeting earlier. His direct contact number is +354 823 0760

Description.nts:gea: Enjoy your day at leisure in Reykjavik. Visit highlights such as Perlan, Church of Hallgrímur (Hallgrímskirkja), Videy Island, the waterfront area & Sun Voyager. For an Icelandic Culinary experience visit Hlemmur Food Hall or Grandi Food Hall.

TripEvent.Name: Private transfer Reykjavik Hotel to Reykjavik Airport
TripEvent.Description: City transfer - RKV AirportPlease be ready at the Hotel lobby 10 minutes before departure.Luggage: 1 suitcase and 1 carry on per person​If you are experiencing any issues with the transfer, please call Iceland Highlights on +354 415 0263

TripEvent.Name: Car hire - Iceland - Category GG
TripEvent.Description: IFBN - Category GG - (4x4) Kia Sportage/Toyota RAV4/similarReykjavik office hours are as below:Skútuvogur 8, IS-104 ReykjavikTel (+354) 568 6915Open: Mon-Fri. 08:00-17:00, Sat 08:00-16:00, Sun: 09:00-16:00Njarðargata, IS-101 ReykjavikTel (+354) 461 6100Open: Mon-Fri. 08:00-18:00, Sat & Sun: 09:00-17:00 After hours emergency phone for Holdur is (+354) 840 6010At the airport, pick up your vehicle from the Europcar/Holdur desk. When dropping the vehicle off in Reykjavik, clients will get a courtesy shuttle transfer to their city hotel. The last shuttle will depart about 60 min prior to office closure. When dropping the vehicle off at Akureyri airport, please note that the airport depot opens ca. 1 hour before the morning flights.You will be picked up from your hotel and taken to Holdur office. Please be patient, your pick up may take up to 30 minutes to arrive.Please note, drive times in this document are approximate, and do not take into account road conditions. Always reserve extra time when driving.Please check today’s conditions at https://safetravel.is/Car hire with Holdur in Iceland includes:Collision Damage Waiver (CDW), Personal Accident Insurance (PAI) , Theft Protection (TP), unlimited mileage, airport charges and taxes, GPS navigational system and VIP Service at KEF airport for pick-up. The VIP service includes; Privileged line and a rental agreement ready for you to sign and the car will be in our VIP parking place just outside the airport.Please note a complimentary hotel pick-up can be arranged on request. A representative from the car rental company will meet you at your hotel lobby and drive you to the nearby rental location where your car is located.NOTE:Additional charges apply for; extra driver, one way fees, young driver damage waiver (for all drivers under 26 years), excess reduction, additional equipment such as child seats, etc.Holdur will charge a pre-authorisation on your Credit Card when you pick up your vehicle for any extra cost that might occur during your rental period. If no charges apply, the pre-authorization is released from the CC after your rental period. The amount of the pre-authorization depends on the insurance / Collision Damage Waiver (CDW) level included in your booking. Standard level is 75.000 ISK and you can lower this amount by choosing another insurance level when picking up your car.After-hours contact number:In case of emergency regarding your rental car outside opening hours please call (+354) 840 6010

Description.nts:gea: Driving and Sightseeing Day 1Tour the highlights of the Golden Circle and the start of the South Coast on your way to Vík:https://maps.app.goo.gl/Wn7LMuod3cVnz3NWANORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. This can slow the roads down, as it can be difficult to pass these vans. Norwegian country roads are often quite narrow. Having said this, these roads are incredibly scenic and have lots of picnic & photo spots. If you are going to be using ferries during your drive, depending on the size of the ferry, this might involve a wait to get on. The ferries are reliable and regular but you may need to arrive early to secure a spot in the line. On some of the ferries, consider catching a ferry outside of the peak times. Your accommodation hosts will have the most up to date local information on hand so ask them for suggestions for your following days travel.ICELAND: In regards to gravel roads; technically you’re not recommended to take a hire car on gravel roads, but in Iceland you may not have a choice. Some guesthouses are located on gravel roads. Consider getting extra car insurance with gravel protection if it is something that might worry you.

TripEvent.Name: Standard room w/mountain view including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: BOOK VIA TRAVIAHótel Kría is situated in Vík. Among the various facilities are a garden, a bar and a restaurant. The black sand beaches begin about 5 minutes' walk from the hotel and it features beautifully decorated rooms in a prime location on the South Coast of Iceland. The hotel has 72 rooms and 1 suite.The Mountain View rooms are designed for double occupancy but can accommodate up to three guests with the option to add an extra bed. Positioned on both the first and second floors of the hotel, these rooms offer stunning views of the mountains. Each room is equipped with WiFi access, a TV, and complimentary tea and coffee amenities.

TripEvent.Name: The Ice cave in Katla - Meet at Vik
TripEvent.Description: 10:00 already fully bookedDaily / 3 hours / 10.00 or 13.30Looking for something off the typical tourist track? This is the tour for you!It’s time to jump into a Super Jeep, strap on your crampons and step into the mighty Myrdalsjokull glacier.Mother Nature has really outdone herself with this one, the movie-like surroundings and glaciers everywhere you look and grand ice walls you walk amongst to enter the magical blue and black ice dome of the outlet glacier named after the powerful volcano Katla. Prepare to be amazed! Included: Helmets and crampons if condition requires.Bring with you: Warm outdoor clothing, waterproof jacket and trousers, head-wear, gloves and lunch. Appropriate hiking boots/shoes are requiredDuration of trip: approx. 3 hours Minimum age: 10 YearsOperates: Daily. All yearSkill level: EasyTour guide will meet you outside the Ice Cave Bistro/Restaurant in Vík. By the entrance at the back of the building, you will be able to find the guide standing by a Super Jeep marked with Southcoast Adventure.

Description.nts:gea: Driving and Sightseeing Day 2After your morning tour to the Katla Ice Cave, continue East to the Glacier Lagoon for your Zodiac Boat tour and finishing your day at the Fosshótel Vatnajökull:https://maps.app.goo.gl/oPGToQZUyWfDUbPWANORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. This can slow the roads down, as it can be difficult to pass these vans. Norwegian country roads are often quite narrow. Having said this, these roads are incredibly scenic and have lots of picnic & photo spots. If you are going to be using ferries during your drive, depending on the size of the ferry, this might involve a wait to get on. The ferries are reliable and regular but you may need to arrive early to secure a spot in the line. On some of the ferries, consider catching a ferry outside of the peak times. Your accommodation hosts will have the most up to date local information on hand so ask them for suggestions for your following days travel.ICELAND: In regards to gravel roads; technically you’re not recommended to take a hire car on gravel roads, but in Iceland you may not have a choice. Some guesthouses are located on gravel roads. Consider getting extra car insurance with gravel protection if it is something that might worry you.

TripEvent.Name: Jökulsárlón Glacier Lagoon Zodiac Adventure Tour
TripEvent.Description: Check-in is 30 minutes before departure on the Zodiac tour. Hotel Kria - Jökulsárlón: 2h20 Jökulsárlón - Fosshotel Vatnajökull: 0h55Book in Bokun - Operates 1 May- 31Oct12% commissionno voucher needed, confirmation reference number is enoughJökulsárlón will send us invoice after travelOn the Zodiac we are able to cover large areas of the lagoon and get closer to the icebergs than on the amphibian. When possible the Zodiac goes almost all the way up to the glacier (as close as safe). Included:• 1 hour guided Zodiac boat tour• Flotation suits and life jackets Please note: Passengers must be 10 years old or older or at least 130 cm tall to go on the Zodiac tour.Check-in is 30 minutes before departure at the ticket office. The location is JÖKULSÁRLÓN (Glacier Lagoon).Please find your voucher with the travel documents.
TripEvent.puPlace: Jökulsárlón Glacier Lagoon Boat Tours and Cafe, Jökulsárlón, 781 Höfn í Hornafirði, IcelandJökulsárlón

TripEvent.Name: Standard room including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: BOOK IN TRAVIAFosshotel Vatnajökull is an attractive hotel in the southeast of Iceland with a spellbinding view of the magnificent glacier Vatnajökull. In beautiful surroundings, the hotel has been designed to make sure your stay is as peaceful and relaxing as possible.Experience charming rooms with captivating views, featuring sleek contemporary design and essential amenities such as a TV, mini fridge, coffee and tea maker, telephone, and complimentary WiFi. Refresh in the well-appointed bathroom before immersing yourself in the serene surroundings just beyond the window.

Description.nts:gea: Driving and Sightseeing Day 3Take your time driving through Iceland's East Fjords finishing the day in Egilsstaðir with a visit to the Vök Baths in the evening:https://maps.app.goo.gl/hgZPGPx8NommGLrAANORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. This can slow the roads down, as it can be difficult to pass these vans. Norwegian country roads are often quite narrow. Having said this, these roads are incredibly scenic and have lots of picnic & photo spots. If you are going to be using ferries during your drive, depending on the size of the ferry, this might involve a wait to get on. The ferries are reliable and regular but you may need to arrive early to secure a spot in the line. On some of the ferries, consider catching a ferry outside of the peak times. TripEvent.Name: Superior room with mountain view including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: access to spa includedThis property is 1 minute walk from the beach. Set in a renovated farmhouse, this guest house is located by Lake Lagarfljót in Eglisstadir village. It offers bright and modern rooms with a flat-screen TV, free Wi-Fi and a private bathroom with shower.The Superior Double with Mountain view is 25sqm in size and has a private entrance and an expansive view of the mountains. Facilities in the room include wooden floor, seating area, bathroom with shower, free Wi-Fi, satellite TV, telephone, tea and coffee making facilities, iron with ironing board and hair dryer.

TripEvent.Name: Admission (unspecified admission)
TripEvent.Description: ??Vök Baths***ISK***​Vök BathsIceland’s only floating infinity poolsExperience the age-old Icelandic tradition of bathing in a natural geothermal pool. Vök Baths is located on the bank of Urriðavatn lake, only a few minutes from the town of Egilsstaðir.At Vök Baths you will find, floating geothermal pools with infinity view, two on shore hot pools, a sauna, cold water spray tunnel, tea bar, an in-water pool bar, and the on-site restaurant, Vök Bistro.Water is lifeIceland is famous for its geothermal activity. However, East Iceland is normally not associated with geothermal heat and considered a cold spot. This makes Vök Baths an even more unique attraction. Throughout the centuries, people living around Lake Urriðavatn noticed certain spots on the lake that curiously did not freeze during winter. The Icelandic name given to these ice-free patches is “Vök” (plural Vakir).The warm water flowing from the ground at Urriðavatn lake is so pure that it is the only geothermal water in Iceland certified as drinkable. You can taste the water and refresh your body at our complimentary tea bar.​https://maps.app.goo.gl/nbLW2FcqGpkLjgHt9

Description.nts:gea: Driving and Sightseeing Day 4Drive through the highlands of Northeast Iceland, stopping at sights along the way before ending in Húsavík for the night:https://maps.app.goo.gl/CUMk1ab4enw2Z8qeANORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. TripEvent.Name: Standard room including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: BOOK VIA TRAVIA, Hotel open Feb-DecFosshotel Húsavík is a well-equipped hotel in the heart of Húsavík, just walking distance from the harbor. Húsavík’s main attraction are the sensational whale watching tours. Húsavík is called the "Whale Watching Capital of Europe" and therefore Fosshotel Húsavík has a whale-themed bistro & bar named after the famous Moby Dick.These standard rooms measure approximately 23 square-meters in size and amenities feature a satellite TV, hairdryer, telephone, mini-fridge, radio, private bathroom and free WiFi.

TripEvent.Name: GeoSea Entrance ticket
TripEvent.Description: Gistihúsið Lake Hotel Egilsstadir - Geosea: 2h45 Geosea - Fosshotel Husavik: 0h005ISK - Book in BOKUNThe GeoSea sea baths i located on the Húsavíkurhöfði cape in North-Iceland. Thanks to the underground heat, the seawater in the baths is warm and comfortable and the mineral-rich water will caress your skin. While the warm sea works its miracles, you can enjoy the view of the mountain range to the west, Skjalfandi Bay beneath the cliffs and the Arctic Circle itself on the horizon.The GeoSea sea baths i located on the Húsavíkurhöfði cape in North-Iceland. Thanks to the underground heat, the seawater in the baths is warm and comfortable and the mineral-rich water will caress your skin. While the warm sea works its miracles, you can enjoy the view of the mountain range to the west, Skjalfandi Bay beneath the cliffs and the Arctic Circle itself on the horizon.StorageYou may put your belongings and valuables into your locker or leave your valuables in the reception.VendorIn the baths guests can purchase a number of beverages like beer, wine and non-alcoholic drinks.HygieneAll guests are asked to take a shower and wash thoroughly before entering the baths. Geosea provides soap, shampoo and conditioner from the Icelandic natural skincare company, Sóley Organics. How to Get here: Follow the yellow Lighthouse. ​Located on the town's northern edge, GeoSea sits at the base of the bright yellow Húsavíkurviti lighthouse.Vitaslóð 1, 640 Húsavík, IcelandPlease find your voucher with the travel documents
TripEvent.puPlace: Geosea - Geothermal Sea Baths, Vitaslóð 1, 640, Húsavík, IcelandHusavik

TripEvent.Name: Húsavík Original Whale Watching
TripEvent.Description: Husavik - Akureyri: 1h00(Priority) 3 hours - Book in BOKUN, 1 Mar - 30 NovExperience the Original Húsavík Whale Watching tour that has built a reputation for the town of Húsavík as the capital of whale watching in Iceland. Discover the magnificent nature of Skjalfandi bay observing whales, dolphins and sea birds in their natural habitat. Enjoy the smooth, safe sailing of a traditional Icelandic oak boat and treat your self to a cup of hot cocoa and traditional Icelandic scones. Recommended by thousands of satisfied travellers worldwide the Original Husavik Whale Watching tour is an authentic wildlife adventure by the pioneers of whale watching in Iceland. Includes: Hot chocolate and cinnamon buns, expert whale watching guide, warm overalls and raincoats if needed.Duration: 3hrsBring with you: Warm clothesMeeting Point: Whale Watching Centre, Hafnarstétt 9, Húsavík 640, ISTour starts at the harbour in Húsavík. The Ticket Centre is located above the harbour across the street from the church. Please arrive at the ticket office in Húsavík no later than 30 minutes before departure to collect your boarding pass.Please find your voucher with the travel documents.
TripEvent.puPlace: North Sailing - Húsavík Whale Watching, Garðarsbraut, 640 Húsavík, IcelandHusavik

Description.nts:gea: Driving and Sightseeing Day 6Head East from Húsavik towards the Northern city of Akureyri. Optional stop at the new Forest Lagoon for a quick dip is highly recommended, then continue into Akureyri for the evening:https://maps.app.goo.gl/qg9EsHoAUZfCbzRM6NORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. TripEvent.Name: Superior room including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: BOOK VIA TRAVIAHotel Kea is located in the very heart of town, next to the iconic church of Akureyri and the town central. Hotel Kea is the only four star hotel in town offering rooms that range from standard to a suite, room service, in house restaurant, bar, conference and meeting halls. The breakfast at Hotel Kea is included in your stay, a fantastic start in the morning.The superior rooms are spacious and neatly decorated in a classic style. They are equipped with modern amenities to ensure a pleasant stay.

TripEvent.Name: Northern Lights Classic Tour
TripEvent.Description: Pick-up starts 30 minute(s) before departure.Book in BokunThis wonderful tour takes you hunting for Northern lights with an expert top rated Northern Lights guide through the winter night. The hunt takes you out of town to the countryside, away from the bright lights of the city so that the Northern Lights can be seen in all their beauty and colours. The local guide will share Icelandic tales during the journey on this magical tour. Please note the Northern Lights are a natural phenomenon and are also dependant on weather conditions therefore it is not possible to guarantee they will be sighted however if the guide confirms no lights were seen, you will be offered a free retry the next day if the tour is running. Departure from: Akureryi HotelDeparture time: 21:30Duration: 2-3 hoursIncluded: Northern Lights guide, transport in a mini bus, Hotel pick up & drop off, Icelandic talesBring with you: Warm clothing and extra layers, gloves

Description.nts:gea: Driving and Sightseeing Day 7Spend the day exploring the remote Northern Peninsulas at your leisure, ending the day at the Brimslóð Guesthouse:https://maps.app.goo.gl/Zy3YAzkzsJJ9Mkdz6NORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. TripEvent.Name: Standard room including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: Private facilitiesBrimslóð Atelier Guesthouse is situated right beside the sea in the oldest part of the village of Blönduós. Enjoy cosy accommodation with magnificent views across the open North Atlantic Ocean to the Westfjords peninsula, delicious home-cooked meals and authentic Icelandic hospitality.The property offers a garden, sun terrace, shared lounge, restaurant and an outdoor fireplace. Guests have the use of free WiFi and free private parking.The standard room is featured with either double or twin beds. It has a private bathroom, free wifi and includes a continental breakfast.​​*if your dinner has been included; The dinner starts at 19:30 for all of our guests. Please advise if you are arriving later by calling the reception + 354 820 0998

Description.nts:gea: Driving and Sightseeing day 8Head into the remote West Fjords of Iceland:https://maps.app.goo.gl/PJpSQ6wpqUt9CYny7NORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. This can slow the roads down, as it can be difficult to pass these vans. Norwegian country roads are often quite narrow. TripEvent.Name: Standard room including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: Book in TraviaHotel Horn is located in the scenic Westfjords village of Isafjordur. This modern hotel offers free parking and brightly decorated rooms with flat-screen TVs and free WiFi access. The rooms have décor inspired by the surrounding nature and include a work desk and a private bathroom with shower.

TripEvent.Name: Superior room including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: Book in TraviaHotel Horn is located in the scenic Westfjords village of Isafjordur. This modern hotel offers free parking and brightly decorated rooms with flat-screen TVs and free WiFi access. The rooms have décor inspired by the surrounding nature and include a work desk and a private bathroom with shower.The superior rooms offer comfort and plenty of space. The rooms are furnished in clean lines inspired by nature around the Westfjords. The room accommodates two people in a double bed. Room facilities include a seating area, bathroom with shower, hair dryer, wireless internet, coffee tray, and 32-42 inch TV.​

Description.nts:gea: Continue your sightseeing drive through the West Fjords, getting to the Brjánslækur ferry int time for the 18:00 departure for Stykkishólmur:https://maps.app.goo.gl/LzxvzfFowctYmEQq8NORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. TripEvent.Name: Ferry one way Brjánslækur - Stykkisholmur
TripEvent.Description: Book in BokunFerry Baldur operates all year round*. The journey time from Brjánslækur - Stykkisholmur is about 2 hours and 30 minutes. Services on board: Located underneath ferry Baldur's vehicle deck, the restaurant Bára offers an assortment of refreshments, including hot and cold meals, drinks and sweets. Free Wi-Fi is available on board.*The ferry does not operate on -Christmas 24 & 25 DecNew year 31 Dec & 1 JanGood Friday & Easter Sunday Seamans holiday: 2 June 2024

TripEvent.Name: Standard room including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: Ask about Hotel Karolina in the booking requestStanding next to the harbor, Hotel Egilsen is set in a newly converted historic house in the heart of Stykkisholmur, The small hotel preserves its classic heritage while enhancing it with the best of modern design. Providing intimate lodging, healthy food, small library and the renowed COCO-MAT beds.The rooms are small but very bright and comfortable. Each room has a private bathroom with overhead power shower.There is one room on the first floor and two that are located on the third floor with one of them having a view towards the harbour. The rooms on the third floor have sloped ceiling but are very comfortable with the all natural COCO-Mat beds, goose-down duvets and pillows with ecological cotton bedcovers. There is also a power shower in the bathroom and L'Occitane amenities.

Description.nts:gea: Driving and Sightseeing day 9Head out early for a day of sightseeing in the Snaefellsness Peninsula, including a whale watching tour, ending in Reykholt for the evening:https://maps.app.goo.gl/8JZydu5PRhZE9y678NORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. TripEvent.Name: Whale Watching from Ólafsvík
TripEvent.Description: (10am was already filled in) Please arrive 30 min before departure to Ólafsvík harbor. Hotel Egilsen - Ólafsvík harbour: 1h00 Ólafsvík harbour - Fosshotel Reykholt: 2h0001 Apr - 15 Sep Book in BOKUNNowhere else in Iceland is there a better chance to see the Ocean's Big Animals than along the Snæfellsnes Peninsula coastline: Sprem, Fin, Humpback, Minke and Killer Whale. Other possible sightings are Sei, Pilot whale plus dolphins and porpoises. This unique trip takes us into the waters where ocean giants swim in the shadow of the magnificent Snæfellsjökull Glacier, searching around the Snæfellsnes peninsula. Nowhere else in Iceland is there a better change to see toothed-whales such as orcas, sperm whales and pilot whales than along this beautiful coastline. The orcas are more often seen in winter and early in the summer, during April and June, but there is a chance of seeing them all the way through the summer months. Male sperm whales can be seen especially in June in deeper water. Other whales that can be seen are humpback whales and minke whales as well as white-beaked dolphins. We get as close as we can without disturbing the whales while we enjoy the spectacle of them feeding and playing.NOTE: Subject of weather conditions.Meeting point: Ólafsvík, Snæfellsnes PeninsulaDuration: Approx 3 hoursBring with you: Warm clothingMin persons on the tour: 4Departure: 1st April to 14th June & 20th Aug to 15th Sept at 13:00. From 15th June to 19th Aug at 10:00 and 14:00.Please be at the meeting point 30 min before tour start. Please contact Laki Tours 24 hours BEFORE the scheduled departure so they can confirm departures of any tours.Contact Tel: +354 5466808

TripEvent.Name: Superior Double room including breakfast
TripEvent.Description: BOOK VIA TRAVIAFosshotel Reykholt is a romantic country hotel in the legendary setting of Reykholt in Borgarfjörður. Once the home of historian and poet Snorri Sturluson, Reykholt is one of Iceland's major historic sites. Bounteous in captivating scenery the area is full of lava fields, waterfalls, mountains, craters and caves. Offering 5 types of hotel rooms, Fosshotel Reykholt is everything you look for in a quiet country hotel. The hotel offers relaxing environment, full of historic remains and attractions for intriguing travelers. The rooms are well designed and equipped with facilities that will make your hotel stay even more enjoyable.Fosshotel Reykholt offers modern and well-designed rooms in a lifely, although relaxing environment in West Iceland. Rooms are equipped with a TV, fridge, hairdryer, coffee & tea maker, telephone, bathroom and free WiFi.

TripEvent.Name: Into The Glacier (Langjokull) from Húsafell
TripEvent.Description: PRIORITY, AA0902 - Bokun - 4 hours, from HusafellNOTE: Due to changing weather conditions, please check the status of the activity at the Front Desk of your hotel the day before or in the morning.Your Into The Glacier Adventure is truly a unique experience. You will get the opportunity of a life time to enjoy one of the world’s greatest wilderness; Iceland’s second largest glacier – from the inside! Never before the Langjokull ice tunnels, has anyone been able to see the beautiful blue ice at the heart of an ice cap glacier. You’ll get to drive in a specially modified snow truck on the glacier, explore the glacier environment, enjoy a view out of this world and go INTO the glacier to experience the glacier’s beauty from the inside!An experienced guide will lead the way the whole time to make sure everyone is enjoying themselves to the fullest. It´s time to take ice cap glacier exploration to a whole new level. Trip details:• Drive yourself from Reykjavik (or another starting point) to Husafell.• During winter, always use road 1 towards Borgarnes and road 50 and 518 to Húsafell.• Specially modified glacier vehicles take you up to the ice tunnels and back, about 30 min. each way during summer and 75 min each way during winter.• Guided ice tunnel tour, approximately an hour• The total duration of the tour is around 4 hours from Húsafell• Please note that the duration of the tour may be longer than scheduled, due to conditions on the glacier.Included:• Tour in a specially modified glacier vehicle on Langjokull glacier. Departure from Húsafell Information Centre • Entrance and English speaking guidance in the ice cave and tunnels.• English speaking driver/ guide/audio guidance.• Free WiFi in glacier vehicles.Bring with you: Warm and waterproof outdoor clothing, gloves, warm undergarment clothing (fleece/wool sweater and pants), warm socks and a change of clothing. Good hiking shoes are recommended.Duration: 4 Hours Minimum age: No Minimum age Please note: • Itinerary is subject to change due to weather conditions or circumstances beyond the suppliers control.• Please note that the duration of the tours may vary according to weather and road conditions.Summer season (1/6-15/10): Please note that the tour departs from Klaki base campPlease note that the mountain road F550 which connects both Húsafell and Þingvellir national park to Klaki base camp is a rough gravel road ONLY suitable for 4×4 vehicles during summer, mid June-mid October. Please take the shuttle from Húsafell if you do not have a 4×4 vehicle. Please note that the shuttle departs from Glacier office in Husafell. Please be ready at least 30 minutes before the shuttle departure.*Winter season (16.10-31.5): Please note that the meeting point is Glacier office in HúsafellPlease be ready at least 30 minutes before the shuttle departure.GPS coordinates:Glacier office in Húsafell – N64 41.950 W20 52.118Klaki base camp – N64 39.014 W20 34.962PLEASE NOTE: ​Since Arctic Adventures does not provide lunch on any of their trips, customers are recommended to bring their own lunch (for the longer trips), snacks and a bottle of water. Sometimes tours will also stop at some gas stations where snacks or coffee can be bought, however, this will mostly depend on the guide and timing (if guests would like to request such stops, there should be no problem to arrange if timings will allow).

TripEvent.Name: Husafell Canyon Bath tour 2hrs
TripEvent.Description: BOKUN - 50% discount for hotel guestHusafell Canyon BathsThere is no experience more authentically Icelandic than hiking through the surreal landscapes of the highlands followed by a relaxing soak in a geothermal pool.Choose from three geothermal pools of varying temperatures, 30-41°C (86-105°F), plus a cold-water spring at 10°C (50°F), each with a spectacular view of the surrounding canyon, mountains and glaciers.An authentic Icelandic SoakConstructed from locally sourced, natural materials like flagstone from the canyon floor, the baths are hot-spring fed pools designed to blend into the environment seamlessly using the age-old methods that created Snorralaug, a heritage site pool dating back to the 10th century. The on-site bathhouse is made from salvaged timbers from the area. Even the hooks in the changing room are repurposed horseshoes from a nearby family farm. The Húsafell locals who undertook the Canyon Baths project went to great lengths to keep the entire structure as environmentally unobtrusive, sustainable and true to the area’s heritage as possible.Hiking to the bathsLed by a knowledgeable local guide, this year-round tour begins with a short ride from the Hotel Húsafell to the trailhead in the remote Icelandic Highlands. On this 2-hour tour we enjoy a relaxed walk among natural wonders not found in many guidebooks, including the spectacular two-tiered waterfall Langifoss. We’ll also learn about Iceland’s renewable energy practices, cross an icy stream of glacial meltwater and see the site to Okjökull, Iceland’s first glacier claimed by climate change.The highlight of our excursion is a serene soak in the recently completed Húsafell Canyon Baths, a surreal hot spring paradise that has to be seen to be believed. Enjoy half an hour of relaxing, recharging and breathing in the pure Icelandic air before heading back to Húsafell. Please bring: Warm, waterproof outdoor clothingHiking bootsSwimsuit and towelSwimsuits and towels can be rented from Hotel Húsafell swimming pool if needed.PLEASE NOTEThis hike is rated as easy and is appropriate for all skill levels. There is a maximum of 20 participants per outing.

Description.nts:gea: Final Driving and Sightseeing dayMake your way back South towards Reykjavik to relax at the Sky Lagoon and spend your last night in Reykjavik:Reykjavik Parking information - https://www.reykjavikrentacar.is/visit-iceland/parking-in-reykjavik---where-can-i-park-and-is-it-freehttps://maps.app.goo.gl/vBW3NEG9zEL6AnuU9NORWAY: Europeans love driving in Norway and during the summer months, the more popular tourist roads becomes crowded with European vans. This can slow the roads down, as it can be difficult to pass these vans. Norwegian country roads are often quite narrow. Having said this, these roads are incredibly scenic and have lots of picnic & photo spots. If you are going to be using ferries during your drive, depending on the size of the ferry, this might involve a wait to get on. The ferries are reliable and regular but you may need to arrive early to secure a spot in the line. On some of the ferries, consider catching a ferry outside of the peak times. Your accommodation hosts will have the most up to date local information on hand so ask them for suggestions for your following days travel.ICELAND: In regards to gravel roads; technically you’re not recommended to take a hire car on gravel roads, but in Iceland you may not have a choice. Some guesthouses are located on gravel roads. Consider getting extra car insurance with gravel protection if it is something that might worry you.

TripEvent.Name: Sky Lagoon Pure Experience
TripEvent.Description: Fosshotel Reykholt - Sky Lagoon: 1h30(Priority) Add city-transfers Iceland highlights if needed,Soak in the beauty of Iceland as you gaze across the infinity edge and watch the Icelandic Sky merge with the Atlantic ocean.Located in Kársnes Harbour, Kópavogur, just minutes from Reykjavik’s vibrant city centre and iconic urban landmarks, Sky Lagoon is a premium oceanfront geothermal lagoon, inspired by the magic of Iceland and showcasing expansive ocean vistas punctuated by awe-inspiring sunsets, Northern Lights and dark sky views.Approximately ​5 km from Reykjavik Centre. Add transfers if needed.Soak in the beauty of Iceland as you gaze across the infinity edge of the lagoon and watch the Icelandic sky merge with the Atlantic oceanThe un-obstructed 70-metre (260 ft) infinity-edge creates the visual effect of the lagoon blending into the Atlantic Ocean, offering you an awe-inspiring and endless vista punctuated with remarkable sunsets, auroras and dark sky views.Your Pure Experience includes:- ocean-side infinity lagoon- the ritual experience- swim up lagoon bar- indoor café and unique retail experience“The Ritual” - an experience inspired by Icelandic tradition:Your deluxe experience includes the seven-step rejuvenating experience ' The Ritual', including a cold pool plunge, ocean-front sauna, exclusive SKY scrub and more.• Step 1: Slow down (lagoon) Soak and relax in the lagoon, breathing in the refreshing air. Dipping in the hot geothermal waters of SKY LAGOON will help guests relax, reduce tension and increase sense of wellbeing• Step 2: Cool down (cold pool) After enjoying the hot water we recommend a cold therapy, either taking advantage of the fresh Icelandic air or if guests are feeling braver, dip into the cold pool. This will stimulate their immune system, decrease blood flow in the body and tighten skin.• Step 3: Relax with a view (sauna) After this cold awakening, guests visit the sauna for 5-10 minutes, allowing the heat to open pours to remove toxins and cleansing the skin. Guests can enjoy the breathtaking views while the heat works its magic.• Step 4: Refresh (cold fog-mist) Guests enter the cold fog-mist and refresh their senses.• Step 5: The SKY scrub (scrub area) Guests then apply our signature SKY body scrub. Exfoliating and applying healing ingredients.• Step 6: Steam (Steam room) The steam will once more open your skin, allowing it to absorb the key therapeutic ingredients and maximizing the hydrating benefits of the SKY scrub.• Step 7: Shower and relax (Shower and lagoon). Close your eyes, feel the results, enjoy the moment Included:• Sky Lagoon Experience including Sky Lagoon Ritual• Access to Public Change Rooms• Towels provided• Drinks for purchase"Children under the age of 12 are not permitted at Sky Lagoon. Visitors ages 12 – 14 must be accompanied by a guardian (18 years or older). Sky Lagoon team members may ask to confirm your child's date of birth using a valid ID card or passport and reserve the right to refuse access if one cannot be provided."​https://maps.app.goo.gl/9KhBjMuoJUYb1WnZ7The recommended time is 1,5–2 hours. It’s very important that you stay hydrated whilst enjoying the warm water. This will help ensure you get the most out of your experience and stay healthy.Please find your voucher with the travel documents.The Sky Lagoon Shuttle is available from central Reykjavík to Sky Lagoon. Return: 2000 ISK paid locally.Please note - The transfer is operated by Reykjavík Excursions (www.re.is)Departure is from BSÍ bus station.There are also several pick up points in Reykjavik. Check with your Hotel Reception for the pick up point closest to your hotel. Pick-up starts 30 minutes before departure.Transfer times from Reykjavík to Sky Lagoon:From Reykjavík: 13:00, 15:00, 17:00 & 19:00From Sky Lagoon: 15:30, 17:30, 19:30 & 21:30

TripEvent.Name: Big Room (including breakfast)
TripEvent.Description: BOOK VIA TRAVIA, Priority, 25% off BAR. Nett rates on TraviaKvosin Hotel is located in the historic Kirkjuvoll building at the center of Reykjavik. The neighbors are Parliament and the Old Downtown Church, so guests are truly part of history. Built in 1900 and refurbished in 2013 all 24 rooms have spacious living areas, cooking facilities, and warm but cool Scandinavian décor.The smallest suites at Kvosin, ironically, are big (26m2), hence the name 'Big Room'. Big on character, big on style, and big on experience. They are much bigger than the average hotel room in Reykjavik with luxury amenities. The Big Room is furnished with 1 queen bed (153x200 cm). Facilities include full kitchenette with refrigerator, Nespresso Coffee machine with complimentary coffee, Samsung Smart TV, Soley Organics Icelandic Toiletries and Icelandic Linens by Lin Designs.

TripEvent.Name: Departure day
TripEvent.Description: Robert & Luz: 29SEP- DL0237 departs KEF 08:50 Ana: 29SEP - DL0247 departs KEF 11:25Return your rental car at the Keflavik Airport and depart Iceland.​Robert & Luz:29SEP- DL0237 departs KEF 08:50Ana:29SEP - DL0247 departs KEF 11:25
